steps: Boil pasta until soft.
Heat olive oil in a pan and add garlic.
Add tomato sauce and cook for 5 minutes.
Mix pasta with the sauce and top with cheese.
Serve hot.
Beat the eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan and pour the mixture.
Add chopped onions and cheese on top.
Flip and cook both sides.
Serve warm.
Boil pasta in salted water until tender, then drain.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add minced garlic, and sauté until fragrant.
Pour in tomato sauce, season with salt, and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Combine the pasta with the sauce, stirring to coat evenly.
Serve hot, optionally garnishing with fresh herbs or cheese.
Peel and chop the banana and strawberries.
Add all ingredients (banana, strawberries, milk, honey) into a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and serve chilled.
Crack eggs into a bowl and beat them with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour the eggs into the pan and let them cook for a few seconds.
Gently stir the eggs continuously with a spatula.
Remove from heat when slightly undercooked, as they will continue to cook from residual heat.
Serve warm with toast or on its own.
Butter one side of each bread slice.
Place cheese slices between two slices of bread (buttered side facing out).
Heat a pan over medium heat and place the sandwich in it.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, pressing lightly, until golden brown and cheese melts.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Cook and chop chicken into small pieces.
Chop vegetables (lettuce, tomato, cucumber) into bite-sized pieces.
Toss chicken and vegetables together in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil, mix well, and serve chilled.
Crack eggs into a bowl and beat them with salt.
Heat butter in a pan over medium heat.
Pour the eggs into the pan and let them cook undisturbed.
Add optional ingredients (like cheese or onions) on top.
Flip the omelette carefully and cook for another minute.
Slide onto a plate and serve warm.
Wash and chop vegetables (lettuce, tomato, cucumber).
Toss all ingredients together in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
Serve fresh as a side dish or main course.
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and add milk.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stirring to remove lumps.
Heat a pan and add butter, then pour a ladle of batter onto it.
Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve warm with syrup or toppings of choice.
Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water and drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and mix with grated cheese.
Cook chopped bacon in a pan until crispy.
Toss hot spaghetti with the bacon, then quickly mix in the egg-cheese mixture.
Add reserved pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese on top.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix melted butter with minced garlic and chopped parsley.
Spread the garlic butter mixture onto slices of bread.
Place the bread on a baking tray and bake for 10 minutes.
Serve warm as a side dish or snack.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, milk, and sugar together.
Dip each slice of bread into the mixture, coating both sides.
Heat a pan with butter and cook each slice until golden brown on both sides.
Serve warm with syrup or powdered sugar.
